description: The 4G governing style looks to be one that is based on collegial leadership and partnership with citizens, says Chua Mui Hoong. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: A new 4G leadership style is taking shape
title_page: A new 4G leadership style is taking shape | The Straits Times
maintext:
Next week is Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loongâ€™s 70th birthday, the date he had given himself, years ago, as the occasion when he would like to hand over Singapore to a new leader.
Instead, Feb 10 will come and go with the same uncertainty in political succession that has prevailed since designated leader Mr Heng Swee Keat stepped aside in April last year. This left the field wide open for three other contenders to vie, openly or covertly, for the top post. Mr Lee has also said more recently he will stay on as PM to see Singapore through the Covid-19 pandemic.
